chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
Hola, necesitas pasar directamente por la mitad del serpiente.
got it! i'm by the snake now
where to next?
oh, no
oops! did i do something wrong? where should i go then?
sí, necesitas comenzar del mapa y pasa por la isla del tigre. Además, pasa por el base de la isla.
gotcha, starting over and passing the tiger island from the bottom
where's next?
Luego, sigue a la isla del pájaro y el elefante. Pasa encima del pájaro y baje a la izquierda del pájaro. Luego, pase a la isla de la rana.
okay, i'm heading over the bird island and down left from it
now at the frog island. what's the next move?
Pase debajo de la rana. Da una vuelta, y cruce el caiman para llegar a la isla del elefante. Pasa debajo del elefante.
alright, passing below the frog, circling around, and crossing the crocodile to the elephant island
i'm below the elephant now. where to now?
Pase a la isla de la jirafa. y luego a la isla del serpiente. Vas a llegar al fin para conseguir el tesoro.  Felicitaciones!
sweet, moving to the giraffe island, then the snake and finally getting the treasure! *finished* good navigation, pal!

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
sí
great! let's move. head west, towards the wooden bench
watch out! there's a trail to cross too. you see it?
yes
super! now, while you're close to the florist stand, take a u-turn to cross the trail again
we're heading back towards our four-legged friend
ok
awesome! now go straight south over the branch
you'll pass another adorable white dog near a red and white checkered picnic
ok im there
perfect! now step over the mat and be careful not to crush the bowl of berries
let's keep going towards the west
ok
great job! now, another wooden branch to cross
this time, we're heading north, over the river. can you handle it?
yes, I'm good
you're doing great! we've crossed the river, now we have to go around a green bush - from the right side please!
ok
fab! once you've circled the bush, head straight to the florist stand
can you see it?
yes
fantastic, buddy! now turn left and go under the stand until you reach a big bridge
ok
cross it, passing by the biking enthusiasts
then continue heading west
ok
you're doing awesome! right past the bridge, there are two lovely old folks, see them?
yes
we're moving south now, just a little bit until we reach another wooden branch
ok
right next to it should be a green bush, can you see that?
yes
perfect! now go east, between the branch and the bush

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
comienza del triángulo
ok, comenzamos en la tienda, ¿hacia dónde voy desde aquí?
vaya al sur a la izquierda del perro. Pare cuando llegues al camino.
siguiendo tus instrucciones, estoy al lado izquierdo desde la vista de ese lindo perrito, ¿ahora hacia donde me dirijo?
Vaya a la derecha y sigue derecho hasta el fuego. Vaya a la izquierda y luego la derecha para pasar encima del fuego.
estoy junto al fuego, un poco caliente aquí amigo, veo un hongo rojo a mi derecha, ¿ahora qué hago?
Pase debajo del hongo rojo al camino y dé una vuelta delante del carro para pasar en el camino. Sigue en el camino pero pare cuando llegues a la primera cruce.
muy bien, he seguido tu camino y estoy al lado del carro azul tomándome un descanso
veo un telescopio azul hacia el sur de aquí, ¿ese es mi próximo paso?
Sí, sigue el camino cuando llegues al telescopio pase entre el telescopio y el arbusto. para llegar al camino otra vez.
hecho, estoy junto al telescopio mirando las estrellas, ¿qué sigue?
Sigue en el camino a la izquierda hasta que llegues a una cabaña. Es el fin.
¡perfecto! acabo de llegar a la cabaña y parece que este es el final del camino
gracias por la ayuda, ¡ha sido divertido! *finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
Sí
great! from the palm trees, go southwest under the first tree
then turn right to cross the second tree. make a sharp left before the third tree and head south
ok
awesome! next, go left of the brown puppy, a little to the left, then right to the south
ok
cool! now, go between the big rock on your left and the small one on your right until you reach the water
yup, that water
ok
nice! now, enter the water until you see a large red crab, then turn right to go west along a big rock
ok
great job! keep heading west in the water until you pass a medium sized rock
then, you'll have to turn sharply right when you see a shark. not too scary, right?
not too scary. I'm good.
awesome, you're brave! now, head back to land, crossing between the medium rock and a ball with blue, yellow and white stripes
keep going north
ok
sweet, make a slight left and head to the northwest
you'll be crossing between a red tent on your left and a big speaker on your right
ok
perfect! now circle the tent in an arc and head south
don't go all the way to the water though!
ok
nice one! make a right turn when you're near the shore, heading west under a red kayak
ok
cool! now, take a sharp 90 degree turn to your right, that's north, alongside the kayak, until you reach a small green bush
well done!

general_survey.answer: I spent a month studying in Mexico in college where I lived with a family and interacted with them daily.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I usually think that they grew up speaking Spanish at home in English in school and are perhaps not totally fluent in all Spanish vocabulary.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I teach Spanish. It would actually be really cool to be able to use your maps or something like them because I teach giving directions in Spanish in the second year Spanish class.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
